comments:
If you upgrade Eclipse using the same folder (e.g., 2.0 and 2.0.1 in this 
case), Eclipse cannot start up.  The following error is recorded in the log 
after a small window appears (briefly) saying "Install being completed" and an 
error window says it cannot start up.


!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Sep 20, 2002 12:16:29.390

!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:

!STACK

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)

	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)

	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:247)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539)

Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Fatal Error: Unable to locate matching 
org.eclipse.core.runtime plugin.

	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.locateDefaultPlugins
(PlatformConfiguration.java:2212)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.<init>
(PlatformConfiguration.java:879)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.startup
(PlatformConfiguration.java:1343)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.initialize
(InternalBootLoader.java:547)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup
(InternalBootLoader.java:904)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:768)

	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)

	... 7 more

Are you extracting the zip file overtop of your old installation or are you 
deleting the old files and then extracting the zip file to the same named 
directory?

From originator:
Overtop, unfortunately. 

One more quick question, how do you start Eclipse? is your workspace in the 
default location?

See my note in your other bug 23911. This may allow you to migrate.
If you copy your old workspace directory to another location and then start 
Eclipse 2.0.1 and point to it via -data it may work. 
Its hard to tell what state your workspace is in after doing the upgrade and 
then trying to back out of it.

from originator: workspace is in default location.

Try copying your workspace from c:\eclipse\workspace (or wherever) to another 
location like c:\workspace.
Then install eclipse to c:\eclipse201.
Then start eclipse with the -data argument.

These are the steps which are mentioned in bug 23911.

Suggestion was:
Try copying your workspace from c:\eclipse\workspace (or wherever) to another 
location like c:\workspace.
Then install eclipse to c:\eclipse201.
Then start eclipse with the -data argument.

Tried this -- same result.  Error message at startup, same as before.  
Apparently I've just hosed up my work space(?)

I believe you can recover from this state by deleting the entire
.metadata/.config/ directory from your workspace.

The suggestion (to remove .config) helped -- can now start up.  But still does 
not see all the project information (even using the -data switch)...  Thanks 
for the suggestion though.

There's nothing really more that we can suggest to help you out.
You may be able to re-create your projects individually.

I appreciate the effort and suggestions.  I just hosed myself somehow, so its 
appropriate to close the "bug".

causedBy.message: Fatal Error: Unable to locate matching  org.eclipse.core.runtime plugin.
